metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8694 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient access control in the Linux kernel driver for some Intel(R) Processors may allow an authenticated user to potentially enable information disclosure via local access. Moritz Lipp, Michael Schwarz, Andreas Kogler, David Oswald, Catherine Easdon, Claudio Canella, and Daniel Gruss discovered that the Intel Running Average Power Limit (RAPL) driver in the Linux kernel did not properly restrict access to power data. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8694` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-4.4.0-194-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-generic - 4.4.0-194.226
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-194-lowlatency - 4.4.0-194.226
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1087-gcp - 4.15.0-1087.100~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-123-generic - 4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Moritz Lipp, Michael Schwarz, Andreas Kogler, David Oswald, Catherine Easdon, Claudio Canella, and Daniel Gruss

notes.Note: sbeattie> fix will be to adjust the access control bits on the RAPL sysfs files.

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-194.226').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1087.100~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.64~16.04.1').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-194.226').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1087.100~16.04.1').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-123.126~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.64~16.04.1').
